title: Accra
description: Ghana's beating heart is sure to inspire love letters. The capital's markets are flush with color and activity

title: Dresden
description: The classic view from the Elbe’s northern bank takes in spires, towers and domes belonging to palaces, churches and stately buildings

title: Fukuoka
description: Sunny, friendly Fukuoka (福岡) is Kyūshū's largest city and Japan's eighth-largest population centre

title: Kuala Lumpur
description: A skyline punctuated by minarets, Mogul-style domes and skyscrapers; colourful, food-stall-lined streets

title: Lima
description: After Cairo, this sprawling metropolis is the second-driest world capital, rising above a long coastline of crumbling cliffs

title: Manchester
description: It was a ballsy statement, given that Manchester's musical renaissance hadn't yet happened, the football teams were mediocren

title: Marseille
description: An exuberantly multicultural port city with a pedigree stretching back to classical Greece and a fair claim to the mantle of France's second city

title: Montevideo
description: The nation’s capital and home to nearly half of Uruguay’s population, Montevideo is a vibrant, eclectic place with a rich cultural life

title: Dublin
description: A small capital with a huge reputation and a cosmopolitan outlook, Dublin has a mix of heritage and hedonism that will not disappoint

title: Nicosia
description: The capital of the Republic of Cyprus is also its cultural heartbeat. Overlooked by most visitors, reduced to a day-tour jaunt from beach resorts
